Key Match Events: Edison Flores was ruled offside by the officials in the 12th minute
Raphinha scored the first goal from the penalty spot in the 38th minute
Raphinha scored a second goal from the penalty spot in the 54th minute
Andreas Pereira scored a third goal with an overhead kick in the 71st minute
Luiz Henrique scored the fourth goal in the 74th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil improved their chances of continuing their unmatched record of being the only nation to have appeared at every tournament since 1930
Five consecutive victories against Peru across all competitions without conceding a goal in the previous four
Dorival Junior's management faced temporary criticism after a last-gasp victory over Chile on Friday
Post-Match Reflections: Raphinha was named Man of the Match
Brazil ends the current cycle of 2026 FIFA World Cup Qualifying matches four points above the final automatic qualification position
Peru faces the challenge of securing the seventh-place inter-confederation playoff position for the World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: Edson saved the first goal due to Edison Flores being offside
Carlos Zambrano committed two fouls leading to penalties for Brazil
